page.title: 13Ampleforth College.
page.content: The College is an Independent Boarding school. Its main purpose is to educate 700 Catholic boys in their faith and all branches of learning. The staff is composed of English Benedictine Monks and an ever increasing number of Lay staff. The school has a Junior House for boys aged 10 to 13 years. The Upper School is for boys aged 13 to 18 and is divided into 10 houses each under a housemaster who is a monk. As well as preparing boys for public examinations it also encourages a wide variety of games such as Rugby, Athletics, Cricket and Tennis. Facilities are provided in a modern sports centre for Squash, Swimming etc. A Design Centre offers opportunities for Creative Arts, such as Photography and Art. At present a new Music centre is near completion.
